body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

**What happened**:

I use [Openstack Block Storage](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/cloud-providers/#openstack) but my cloud provider doesn't support Openstack LBaaS. Because of the latter I've been using MetalLB instead to get things going. However I keep getting warnings when deploying a `ServiceType: LoadBalancer` when there is no `[LoadBalancer]` configuration defined in `cloud.conf`.  [Reference](https://github.com/google/metallb/issues/269#issuecomment-400727870)

NOTE: `cloud.conf` has only a `[Global]` section - there is no mention no `[LoadBalancer]` section.

**What you expected to happen**:

`service-controller` should not print warning via Openstack LoadBalancer since it doesn't support/can't do anything with it.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

- Configure `cloud.conf`

```
[Global]
auth-url=<value>
username=<value>
password=<value>
region=<value>
tenant-name=<value>
tenant-id=<value>
```
- [Install MetalLB](https://metallb.universe.tf/installation/)
- Push a `layer2` [ConfigMap](https://metallb.universe.tf/tutorial/layer2/#configure-metallb)
- Create a [LoadBalancer](https://metallb.universe.tf/tutorial/layer2/#create-a-load-balanced-service)

**Anything else we need to know?**:

See this [issue](https://github.com/google/metallb/issues/269#issuecomment-400727870)

**Environment**:

See this [issue](https://github.com/google/metallb/issues/269#issuecomment-400727870)

title: Support enabling BlockStorage but disabling LoadBalancer in cloud provider
